result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vala Louise Quaderer

records.addlTxt:
OFF THE RECORD / 10:40 AM Defendant Vala Louise Quaderer in court.  Attorney Greg Novack not in court for Vala Louise Quaderer.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attny Thomas-Schmidt request adjournment.   Court addresses DEF on bond conditions.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Initial appearance scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Apply Bond Money to Outstanding Court Obligations
Cash bond AMENDED to SIGNATURE BOND with same conditions

No unsupervised visits with J.A.B. dob: 7/11/2020

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing on October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:15 AM Defendant Vala Quaderer in court. Jennifer Gross appears for the State.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court reviews the Court record.    State indicates no incident report has been received.   Court addresses DEF on qualification for PD, DEF indicates she does qualify.  Court modifies bond to SIBS $1000 with same conditions.   Posted Cash Bond $1000 to be retuned to poster.  
Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:11 AM DE Vala Quaderer in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appears by video. Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak argues bond.  Court sets bond.   Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for  9/27/2022  at 8:30AM.
